item.title: Givemod
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

if (command.startsWith("givemod") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("phil") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("alex")) { String name = command.substring(8); try { int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name); client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p]; c.sM("You have been promoted to Moderator by "+playerName+". Log out to see changes."); c.playerRights = 1; savegame(true); sM("You've promoted "+command.substring(4)+" to Moderator."); } catch(Exception e) { sM(name+" either isn't online or doesn't exist"); } }

As you can see here, all I did was add an extra conditional or operator and added your friend. The conditional or operator (||) checks to see if one expression or another is true when evaluated in a statement.

Read full topic

if (command.startsWith("givemod") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("phil")) { String name = command.substring(8); try { int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name); client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p]; c.sM("You have been promoted to Moderator by "+playerName+". Log out to see changes."); c.playerRights = 1; savegame(true); sM("You've promoted "+command.substring(4)+" to Moderator."); } catch(Exception e) { sM(name+" either isn't online or doesn't exist"); } }
